comments.commentBody: Ironic that yout live in the "Home of Sandy relief" yet you want to cut aid to those who need it.
How did that work out for you in the 14 mid-terms?

We are ruining our elegant system of government
We are ruining our beautiful natural environment
We are ruining our middle class
We are ruining America
... with money and greed

An ironic and quintessential American tragedy
The amount of money the Koch brother's will spend on the elections makes my college tuition look like change found at the bottom of a washing machine at the laundromat.
So evidently, there aren't going to be that many votes against the Kochs
The first step is calling it what it is. Strip away the democratic veneer and examine it in the light of day. We live in an oligarchy, period.
And will you vote based on the last television ad you see? I'm going to guess that you are too smart to be swayed by all this spending and it's just your fellow citizens that you are worried about.
And everybody wonders why voter apathy is so rampant.  I'll keep voting but you read stuff like this and wonder what the point is.
Unlike you, liberals would complain even if the wrong doing is done by another liberal.  Liberals would have know issue with publicly funded elections.

You really have to be completely out of your mind to believe there is any way that this can possibly be good for the people of the United States of America.  Whatever laws are needed to stop this sort of election rigging, failure to enact them means the end of our democracy.
The contributions from liberals like Sonos isn't even close.  Do your research.
"The People" will be muzzled by then.  The Kochs and the other multi-billionaires will be in charge of who says what and when - if at all.  It is a good time to be  very old......

I was telling someone about this article and the Kochs $900 million of their money going for their political campaign contributions. He said, "What!??? They already own the Congress and the Supreme Court, now they want to own the presidency."

Should they win all three branches of government in 2016, will we have to change our country's name to the Disunited States of Koch?
I don't know what your problem is.  '...expansive network house groups..'; sounds like grass-roots effort.  THE KOCHS ARE COMMUNITY ACTIVISTS!  Agitating, agitating, agitating.

And they own the supreme court. The question to ask is, "How will this country survive these people, these outright crooks who portray themselves as honest brokers of a political philosophy based on lies and pain and destruction."

And they own the supreme court.
Obscene.  Things in this country have gotta change.
The Koch Brothers fund the Tea Party, so it's hard for me to imagine that anyone who accepts that moniker will ever notice this problem.  Here's hoping though.
The American Republic was killed long ago by Franklin Delano Roosevelt and the Democrats when government assumed powers the Constitution never granted.

If this doesn't put into stark relief the idiocy of the Citizens United decision, I don't know what will. Can it not be obvious even to the 5 Supreme Court justices responsible for that travesty what a complete disaster has resulted? Now it is clear that the floodgates are open for the ultra-rich to control the election process. Truly this is the downfall of American democracy. If this does not stop, the "great experiment" is finished.

If you're not a multimillionaire, your voice is drowned out. I have said it before, and I will keep saying it: if money = speech, then speech is not free.

Given that the mega billionaires seem to have money to burn, it's long past time for a tax of, say, 95% on all personal assets over $1 billion. The proceeds could be used to fund infrastructure or even The War on Terror (tm).
Probably a whole lot less than the Kochs.
Charles, did it occur to you that being a Democrat is not an absolute guarantee of being sensible, just as being a Republican is not an absolute guarantee of being senseless?
I think you are confusing a recursive function with a tautology. Look up recursion and read my comment again in light of what you have learned.

"Just as our government endangered hundreds of millions of citizens with their nuclear posturing, they have also in this case with their scam meant to sabotage the Iranian nuclear program, which could have brought on retaliation against Americans through state sponsored terror."

Change the words "scam meant to sabotage the Iranian nuclear program" to, "misguided clandestine adventure to assassinate Osama bin Laden, and you have exactly what the "I hate our government no matter what" crowd (sadly, seen largely on the Left) would have been saying if the successful bin Laden op had gone awry.
Our gov't. has done a number of despicable, illegal things in the black ops and intel area area from the Bush II era into the Obama era that I deeply resent and deplore, but the Sterling incident appears so far NOT to be one of them. Mindless backbiting without proper cause is not in the national interest.

When our government begins acting like an international bully and rogue state, then who exactly are you "serving" by honoring your so-called security clearance?
You have not only drank the "Kool-aid", you're on an I.V. drip.

We had no choice, Sarah Palin and Paul Ryan,.Catfish hunter, were attached to reasonable candidates. And guess what happens in 2016? War monger Hillary vs whoever the far right loonies either pick or attach to fairly reasonable folk, but re Jeb, remember Nancy scheivo and his fight to keep a sadly brain dead person alive for political reasons.

Clearly, as demonstrated by history going back to the start of the Cold War, the government has veiled it's adventurism as "National Security" when the reality is that their secrecy is meant for "Government Secrecy". Just as our government endangered hundreds of millions of citizens with their nuclear posturing, they have also in this case with their scam meant to sabotage the Iranian nuclear program, which could have brought on retaliation against Americans through state sponsored terror. The government is quite cavalier about risking the vast American public.

In this case, the government has not only prosecuted a single man, but having done so, has put fear in the hearts of all other government employees.

America is no longer a free nation despite government propaganda to the contrary. It is a repressive and extremely dangerous government making moves to suppress the public through fear and intimidation.

We no longer have a government of the people, but a government of the government people.

When a government employee advises the public of government wrongdoing, he is a hero, not a spy. You should now recognize the true danger the public is in from the government now as this whistleblower was properly telling the American public about actions that endangered the public.

I have such deep regret for voting for Obama that I will never vote again.

Dr. K,

Your blogs on Greece has provided me with a great education in government finance. This blog has put the Greek debt into perspective. Clearly, the issue is the their unemployment and the near collapse of essential services/safety net programs. In my view it is the mission of the I.M.F. to provide liberal expansionism to preserve global economic stability.

Greece is a good market for the World and Europe. It would be folly to allow Greece to collapse. Your last sentence in this blog gave me some hope that our money supplier will have enough sense to forgive, restructure, or write down the debt and interest and give the new liberal government a fighting chance.

Your analysis makes a good case that restoring Greece to economic stability and a place where their citizens can lead a good life is possible.

Question for your experts that I have been asked today: Who will take a hit if the debt is restructured or the worst case defaults on payments? Is it private lenders or is it the I.M.F. et al? Greece is not a big debtor especially for a nation that has been in decline for years and experiencing a very long term period of high unemployment. Remember most of capital is in the hands of very few.

The I.M.F. seems to be an excellent analytics team but were very wrong- headed to beat up an economy as a means to correct behavior.

Anyhow, I will continue to read how this fascinating challenge will be resolved. It is a great case for "How Nation's Fail".
McQueen, he is precisely trying to "sabotage" a deal.  Or else he's very different in private from what he is in public.  Which is possible, but probably not on this issue.
Just imagine if the Kochs had used all the money they've spent bankrolling hate-mongers and lunatics on pay increases for the hard-working employees responsible for their corporate profits!
